paragraph.htmltext: Cells shall be designed to safely withstand anticipated abuse conditions for vehicular applications. The design shall be so that cells do not present a safety hazard under conditions of normal (intended) use.

The design process includes definition of nominal cell performance, physical and chemical design parameters, analysis of and mitigation of known and potential faults, characterization of the manufacturing process capability (or specification of processes requirements for the manufacture of a cell), and the initial confirmation of cell performance.The following items need to be considered:

  • Selection and characteristics of a separator material.
    The separator physically prevents internal short circuits inside the cell by separating the anode from the cathode and provides a path of ionic current flow inside the cell. As it also shuts down the ionic conductivity if the cell temperature increases, it has also a safety function. In the selection of the separator material chemical, electrochemical, thermal and mechanical stability are together with the shutdown resistance, strength and physical integrity important parameter
  • Electrodes shall be designed for performance safety and durability in the designated application.
  • Electrode capacity balance and geometry
  • The electrode tabs, connection to cell terminals, shall be of optimal length and tabs shall not overhang the opposite end of the electrodes, except by design.
  • Tab insulation
  • Overvoltage protection

Safety materials and components

To ensure the design and development of a safe battery pack, we must ensure all levels of battery manufacturing: cell, module, pack, system, user and environment. The aim of this step is to give module, pack assemblers more background information on the materials and components used in a cell to make the cell safer (less reactive, more stable).

To ensure the safety of a single cell researcher are tailoring physical, chemical, electrical and other properties of the positive and negative electrodes and the materials that electrically insulate them to make them less reactive. On electrolyte level, studies are performed to reduce the flammability.

The cell producer can use specific materials on different phases of the cell design to increase the safety:

  • Electrodes manufacturing: Coatings are used to improve the thermal stability, to prevent overcharge. Other electrodes have a thermal protection mechanism which prevents thermal runaway, side reaction. Sub layers can also be used to prevent overcharge and to block surface reactions on the cathode.
  • Cell assembly: Separators between cathode and anode are used to improve mechanical integrity. Shutdown separators improve the thermal stability. A third type of separator reduces the flammability of the electrolyte. The cell producer can also use electroactive polymers which have the ability to switch rapidly between conductive and insulating states and sustain high-current densities. A flexible framework can be added to host the liquid electrolyte and which to decrease the leakage of the electrolyte.
  • Electrolyte manufacturing: agents and additives can be added to decrease flammability and to inactivate the cell if needed.

Next to materials, the following components can be used:

  • Safety vents or tear away tabto release internal pressure due to gas formation in a 'controlled way'
  • Positive temperature coefficient (PTC)device which prevents high external current if the temperature is too high

The insulation resistance between the positive terminal and externally exposed metal surfaces of the battery excluding electrical contact surfaces shall be not less than 5 MÎ© at 500 V d. c. when measured 60 s after applying the voltage. The design of the terminals shall ensure that maximum anticipated current can be carried. Conductive materials with good mechanical strength and corrosion resistance shall be used for external terminal contact surfaces. The way they are arranged shall minimize the risk of short circuit

The design of the terminals shall ensure that maximum anticipated current can be carried. Conductive materials with good mechanical strength and corrosion resistance shall be used for external terminal contact surfaces. The way they are arranged shall minimize the risk of short circuit.

The following types of terminals are used in portable applications:

  • Cap and base: This type of terminal is used for cylindrical batteries that have the cylindrical side insulated from the terminals. The metal cap on the center electrode and the button of the battery serve as the terminals.
  • Snap: This type of terminal consists of a stud for the positive terminal and a socket for the negative terminal. These shall be made from nickel-plated steel or other suitable material. They shall be designed to provide a secure physical and electrical connection when filed with similar corresponding parts for connection to an electrical circuit.
  • Slide contacts -flat-plate, recessed, exterior contacts
    Contacts are typically arranged in a multiple array. Slide contact terminals include the negative and positive connections. In addition, when applicable, connections for the thermostat, thermal fuse, or other functions may be present. These exterior slide contacts are usually made of plated steel or other suitable material, and they may have different sizes and shapes.
  • Plug in connectors
    This type of terminal shall consist of a suitable assembly of metal contacts, mounted in an insulating housing or holder and adapted to receive corresponding contacts of a mating plug in such a manner as to ensure good electrical connection and proper voltage/farm factor  0 polarization

Mechanical requirements

A rigid casing of sufficient strength shall be used for a cell of a user-replaceable battery to prevent flexing that would result in damage to the cells or internal protective components . If metallic lithium is exposed when the casing is opened, a tool providing the mechanical advantage of a pliers, screwdriver, or hacksaw shall be the minimum capable of opening the user-replaceable cell casing.

Electrolyte

A user-replaceable cell shall not contain pressurized vapour or liquid which could spray material in the eye or leak more than 5ml of liquid when the casing is punctured under normal laboratory conditions.

Quality plan

The manufacturer shall prepare and implement a quality plan that defines procedures for the inspection of materials, components, cells and which covers the whole process of producing each type of cell. Manufacturers should understand their process capabilities and should institute the necessary process controls as they relate to product safety.
